title: Calories in a California Roll
meta_description: Learn calories in a california roll, with full nutrition facts including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard 8-piece roll (~240 g) with imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, sushi rice, nori, and rice vinegar seasoning; no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, brand of ingredients, roll size, and preparation; check labels or sources when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard California roll provides ~255 kcal, 38 g carbs, and 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a california roll?
faqs.a: About 255 kcal for a standard 8-piece California roll.

faqs.q: What's the carb count in a California roll?
faqs.a: Approximately 38 g carbs, mostly from the sushi rice.

faqs.q: How much protein is in one California roll?
faqs.a: Around 9 g protein, primarily from the imitation crab.

faqs.q: Are California rolls high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, ~630 mg sodium per roll due to seasoned rice and soy elements.

faqs.q: How many pieces are in a typical California roll?
faqs.a: Usually 6â€“8 pieces per roll; nutrition here assumes 8 pieces.
